definition: Aladdin, character in one of the tales in the The Book of One Thousand and One Nights
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)

sentences.english: The next day, when we watched “Aladdin, ” she let me be Princess Jasmine.
sentences.chinese: 转天，我们一起看“阿拉丁”时，她让我做茉莉公主。

sentences.english: The sword did its work quickly, and Abanazar never opened his eyes again.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉丁手起剑落，阿巴那扎尔就再也没有睁开眼睛了。

sentences.english: The litter went past Aladdin, but for some minutes he did not move.
sentences.chinese: 轿子过去好一会儿了，阿拉丁还是待在那儿没有动。

sentences.english: Aladdin, I am your uncle, Abanazar.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉丁，我是你的叔叔阿巴那扎尔啊。

sentences.english: Aladdin went away and got the fruit from the magic garden under the ground.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉丁去把那些在地下花园里摘到的果子拿了出来。

sentences.english: The next day Abanazar arrived at Aladdin's house.
sentences.chinese: 第二天阿巴那扎尔来到阿拉丁的家中。

sentences.english: There, the magician gave some fruit and wine to Aladdin's mother.
sentences.chinese: 回到家时，魔术师送阿拉丁的妈妈一些水果和酒。

sentences.english: But only Aladdin and his mother knew about the magic lamp and the jinnee.
sentences.chinese: 但只有阿拉丁和他母亲知道神灯和神灵的事。

sentences.english: So Aladdin let his mother go to ask whether the princess would marry him.
sentences.chinese: 于是阿拉丁就让母亲去问一问公主是否愿意嫁给他。

sentences.english: About a year ago, we started a project called Aladdin.
sentences.chinese: 在一年之前，我们启动了一个叫“阿拉丁“的项目。

sentences.english: But without his magic lamp , what could Aladdin do?
sentences.chinese: 但没有神灯，阿拉丁能做什么呢？

sentences.english: Abanazar had tears in his eyes and Aladdin 's mother began to cry too.
sentences.chinese: 阿巴那扎尔眼含热泪，阿拉丁的母亲也哭了起来。

sentences.english: Alighting Award belongs to the public welfare activities, no need to pay the entry fee.
sentences.chinese: “阿拉丁神灯奖”纯属公益活动，无需缴纳报名费。

sentences.english: He wanted to make Aladdin poor again.
sentences.chinese: 他想再把阿拉丁变成穷光蛋。

sentences.english: Aladdin flew on his magic carpet to China.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉丁坐着他的魔力神毯飞向中国。

sentences.english: Aladdin is flying on his magic carpet.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉丁乘着他的魔毯飞行。

definition: Acre, city in Israel, also known as Akko
Effendi, wily and fearless hero of Uighur folk tales/smart guy
Pocahontas (c. 1595-1617), native American noted for her association with the colony of Jamestown, Virginia
Barth or Barthes (name)/Roland Barthes (1915-1980), French critic and semiotician
headman (of primitive people)/tribal chief/used as translation for foreign leaders, e.g. Indian Rajah or Arab Sheik or Emir
(loanword) caliph/also written 哈利發|哈利发[ha1 li4 fa1]
